str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fill with power, strengthen, make strong. From en and dunamoo; to empower.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A proclamation, preaching. From kerusso; a proclamation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres and phoreo; to carry out fully, i.e. Completely assure, entirely accomplish.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
A lion. A primary word; a 'lion'.
